alert.note: Alert for Otero Mesa; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...An outflow boundary with strong winds will impact portions of southern Otero, west central Hudspeth and El Paso Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 501 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary near Northeast El Paso, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and blowing dust lowering visibilities SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Tornillo, Fabens, Clint, Horizon City, Hueco Tanks, Indian Cliffs Ranch, San Elizario, Fort Bliss, Socorro, Sparks, Homestead Meadows, Agua Dulce, Biggs Field, Dairyland and Butterfield. This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 20 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
